description: The media’s hypocrisy and hyperventilating in the age of Trump - The Washington Post
extended: Correction: An earlier version of this piece incorrectly identified former columnist Joseph Alsop’s employer. He was a syndicated columnist; he did not work for the New York Times. This version has been updated. Facts are stubborn things.

description: Want to be part of the next wave of activism? Move to rural America | World news | The Guardian
extended: Traumatized by Occupy’s dissipation, the founder of the movement realized that street protests have become outdated. Now he’s focusing on hyper-local activism It took a few years before Micah White, the co-founder of Occupy Wall Street, could speak of the movement as a failure.

description: www.nytimes.com
extended: Knoxville, Iowa — One recent morning, I sat near two young men at a coffee shop here whom I’ve known since they were little boys. Now about 18, they pushed away from the table, and one said: “Let’s go to work. Let the liberals sleep in.” The other nodded. They’re hard workers.

description: www.nytimes.com
extended: The University of Michigan football team took the field for its season opener on Sept. 3 accompanied by Michael Jordan, the team’s honorary captain for the game, in uniforms bearing his signature Jumpman logo.

description: Black Lives Matter activist DeRay Mckesson's Twitter hacked Friday morning - Baltimore Sun
extended: The Twitter account of Black Lives Matter activist and former Baltimore mayoral candidate DeRay Mckesson was hacked Friday morning, sending out a series of uncharacteristically Mckesson tweets, including an endorsement for presumptive Republican presidential nominee Donald Trump.

description: Must Watch: Senator Ron Wyden Heads to the Senate Floor Today to Oppose Mass Hacking | Electronic Frontier Foundation
extended: You may have already heard of Rule 41: EFF and allied digital rights groups have been raising the alarm about this extra-legislative rule change. In short, the pending updates would make it easier for the government to get a warrant to hack1 into computers.

description: My Search For A Lesbian Donald Trump Supporter | The Huffington Post

description: Anonymous activist who helped expose Steubenville rape pleads not guilty to hacking | Mic
extended: Lexington, Ky. — Deric Lostutter — the Anonymous-affiliated hacker who helped expose the violent rape of an underage girl in Steubenville, Ohio — pled not guilty Wednesday to four felony counts of hacking.

description: How Arianna Huffington Lost Her Newsroom | Vanity Fair
extended: In August 2014, Arianna Huffington, the wealthy, Greek-born co-founder of the Huffington Post, got a brief e-mail from her friend Fareed Zakaria.

description: How Facebook News Feed Works | TechCrunch
extended: This is the ultimate guide to how Facebook chooses what to show in your News Feed, and how you can get your content seen by more people. Understanding how the News Feed works is tough because the algorithm is always changing.

description: Is Robert Del Naja the real Banksy? Massive Attack member is named as graffiti artist | Daily Mail Online
extended: The hunt for the true identity of Banksy took a new twist today after a member of Massive Attack was named as the artist. Robert '3D' Del Naja, the founding member of the Bristol band, has been accused of being the guerrilla graffiti star because art keeps appearing near their gigs.

description: Is Rudy Giuliani Losing His Mind? - POLITICO Magazine
extended: All summer long, Rudy Giuliani has acted as if he’s in a contest with Donald Trump to prove who the most manic 70-something from the outer boroughs really is.

description: No coding in Palo Alto? City takes on Silicon Valley growth
extended: The birthplace of Hewlett Packard and Xerox Parc and founding place of Facebook is now considering whether to enforce a zoning regulation banning firms whose “primary business is research and development, including software coding,” according to the New York Times.
